snippet: Since 1964, Edouard E. Plummer has taken promising poor and minority children and, in one intense year, given them the tools to get into — and thrive at — the nation’s leading schools and beyond.
abstract: Side Street column profiles Edouard E Plummer who has, since 1964, taken promising poor and minority children living in Harlem and, in one intense year, given them the tools to get into and thrive at the nation’s leading schools and beyond; Wadleigh Scholars Program, under Plummer, has helped put more than 500 disadvanaged young people from Harlem into108 different boarding and preparatory schools.
lead_paragraph: Since 1964, Edouard E. Plummer has taken promising poor and minority children and, in one intense year, given them the tools to get into — and thrive at — the nation’s leading schools and beyond.

headline.main: A Half-Century of Guiding Young Scholars in Harlem
headline.print_headline: A Half-Century of Guiding Young Scholars in Harlem
